conclusion: Analyze the U-I graphs for the power source and the small light bulb.
The intersection point of line A and curve B represents the operating point of the circuit.
From the graph, the intersection occurs at I = 2 A and U = 2 V.
The output power of the power source is the power delivered to the light bulb.
Output power P_out = U × I = 2 V × 2 A = 4 W.
The EMF of the power source is the voltage when no current is drawn.
From line A, the EMF is the y-intercept, which is 3 V.
The total power of the power source is the product of the EMF and the current.
Total power P_total = EMF × I = 3 V × 2 A = 6 W.
The output power of the power source is 4 W.
The total power of the power source is 6 W.
